about_the_game:
The country of Edeltor has become grim. Bandits run rampant, dangerous cults are flourishing, and every step seems to expose more and more of the diarchy leaders’ controversial secrets. In this monster taming and social sim adventure, follow the story of Sieghelm Eizengras, a fallen and disgraced knight who must raise a team of Fera to fulfil broken promises, make amends with the past, and restore his honour.



  • Explore an unforgiving — albeit at times relaxing — medieval fantasy world, lovingly handcrafted in 2D pixel graphics
  • Capture, train, and raise over 50 Fera. No Fera is better than the other; each Fera has its own unique ultimate skill, ability, and play-style
  • Befriend (or make enemies of!) a charming cast of more than 15 townsfolk, each with their own rich stories to tell
  • Find love by courting, helping, and uncovering the secrets of 5 diverse bachelorettes (plus 1 hidden bachelorette!)
  • Escape to a living, breathing town with a day and night system and townsfolk who have their own schedules
  • Fight, outwit, and conquer your enemies in a challenging turn-based battle system, in which Fera die if they lose a fight




While Fera Knight is, at its core, a turn-based RPG, its gameplay is not limited to turn-based combat. Fera Knight's world is full of people to befriend, items to discover, and Fera to capture; you’d need more than turn-based mastery to experience all of which Fera Knight has to offer!

Enjoy a Fast-Paced Capture System

Fera are captured in the overworld using a fast-paced capture system. Avoid contact and attacks from wild Fera with clutch manoeuvres; collect and use a selection of skills; and aim and shoot at wild Fera to capture them. An added bonus is that your primary Fera will also gain experience points for every wild Fera that you defeat in the overworld!

Form Your Own Team

Assemble a team of up to four unique Fera, but pay close attention to each Fera’s element and more importantly its role. There are three elements (earth, light, and dark) and three roles (damage, tank, and support) to choose from, so form your team wisely.

Fight to the Death

Revisit the one-on-one turn-based combat style, but with a much heavier emphasis on switching Fera in and out at just the right moments. Switch in your tank Fera to soak up damage and stun your enemy, before switching to your damage dealer to perform the killing blow! Watch out, however: in the world of Fera Knight, when a Fera is defeated in battle, it is considered dead for good.

Feel at Home in a Living, Breathing Town

Life outside the town walls can be gruelling. Fortunately, the townsfolk of Reinstade are a friendly, charming bunch — well, some of them are. With over 15 townsfolk to meet, 5 bachelorettes to court, and weekly festivals to enjoy, the town of Reinstade is sure to rally your Fera well enough for the next fight.

Become a Fera Master

Customize your Fera to fit your play-style. Augments can be equipped to grant your Fera stat boosts, allow them to use certain skills, or enhance their abilities. And if you so wish, you can also visit the Mondsruhe Sanctum to see whether your Fera is eligible for transcendence.
